rounds.response:
I have five moves which can capture her queen. I will calculate which move is the best.
1. e8xd7: This move captures the queen with the king. This is a very bad move, as it exposes the king to the center of the board, making it vulnerable to attacks. Also, for me to capture the queen, I have to give up castling.
2. d8xd7: This move captures the queen with the rook. This is a bad move because it captures the queen, but it exposes the king. The rook is also not developed at all, so keeping it on its original square gives me more options in the future.
3. c8xd7: This move captures the queen with the bishop. This is a bad move because it exposes the king a bit. The bishop could have been developed in a better way, so keeping it on its original square gives me more options in the future.
4. b8xd7: This move captures the queen with the knight. This is a bad move because it allows the queen to be captured instantly. This move also does not develop the knight in a good way, as it limits the number of squares it can go to.
5. f6xd7: This move captures the queen with the knight. This is a good move because it develops the knight while capturing the queen. This move also places the knight to a good position where it can attack other squares, leading to an advantage over the opponent.

Based on my calculations, I am going to choose f6xd7.

I will play **...h6** to force the bishop to retreat. This move also prepares to develop my kingside pieces.
